TextBlock.TextLine: C@ 11 april 1682
London m. Luey Knightley
I have before mee yd. of 21t pase reourne you thanckes for yd cordial opinios
you save of mee. Inclosed my bill for £60- att uss on m. Ed. Warner, for
which pllase to procure the needfull & pass to my acctt. when rad I have
not had from you any other acctt butt what you wat mee where yu sendad
the 2 last bales away, & by that itt doth not, come to so much you say, butt I supose
there are charges, which will make itt up, of which please donce the favour
to send a particolar note, I do not remitt the nette somme of the bat
because I exspect a fine assortment of reds from you, & then y'ls make itt
even, pay let mee heare pom you, & if you can, send me some att least, &
I'll satisfye you wish thankes. I have had the news of handal & others, &
Buskes att Exon beeng stept aside, butt god bethancked, I had never any
dealings with either, where in I can serve you frely commande
Brussel n ant. Rosseau
a4d
je vous aiy oblie a iex de demander quelque a les de toil crai vous
prient de me faire la grace d'envoyer pour demain 56 bellus ie toit
fine sans faut, ayent besoing pour send leinde de bon mettion, suis que
je van envoijeren les danteller du vol deman
Epon m. witt. Lobbrs
C 11d
mj bast to you was on the 4h crtt. which I hope & formar shall be comturdnough
to gett a bale of 22 yd serges a board wills in which pray neglett nothing, which
must be assorted as the inclesed patt, which returne you, butt not so high in prysen
for I have recd. that bale, & suide the grayes inferier by 4ƒ a p to the sparrain
grayes & the golde cullours also not worth theim prise, so that I feare not to
be able to gett any thiugh by them, so pray make emends by this, & give my an
epact accctt. of every perticulier as others do, I have recd yd of 18th past I do nrt
doubt butt m. Cole shall duely comply with yd draughe, which I'll discharge ith
all pinctualitre necessany, inclosed my bill for £50- att vl an m. itt. scaly,
neron for which pletse to procure the needfull, & advise mee what passer
Pray minde these 22 yd. serges, & then I may thinck to come to a considenable
fancell
a11d
londen mr. Edmind Warnet
mij last to you was on the 4h curtt. sence non from you, inclosed an invoice
of the packett EIW N.21 amd. to £136„3„8 flamith for which if you
finde itt right please to give mee credit, this packett goith forward the 13: prest
you shall have invoyces of N.22, & of the stolen goods all which I hope att neuprrite
before later end of nopt week, for wee must take the ficurest way for conviance
wee can, because all shuys here go vere duordrdley, yett wee are not altoghetier, pust
of yett of recovering some thing, by the states of flanders, of which next wah also, wa
shall give the last attempt & & fuls advise to you. Daveing occosion to paym. lucy inglely
£60- st have valuwed d' humm on you this day 2 att 33.3 for which please to give due
honar, & note accordingly. I shall compleat about 3 packetts of thhe good cheap, & the rest
you must exspect as lest I can have itt, butt I worder you order con for wight reylen
of ½ a yd. ⅔ & there abouts broad, of cwlich I send severall te Eng. for yd. gad
Londen m. Juqu Cole
mij last to you was on the 8t currtt. advisingh of £50 which m. Well Lobbe have
drawne on you, which I hope you shall have accepted, & for yd nembours redrawor mee
att 2147 which will be discharged with all puncualitie, by yd nept you will oblige mee
to accquaint mee of their qualitie, & if with safery I mighs trust on them in the like occs
I shall not faile to serve you inclosed the neet accompt, or invoyce of the so ocheads of
cloverseeds bought & provided for yd acctt & loaden aboard John Evinghs att Brudges bound
for topsame, where I do not question butt he is before now arrived, I hope you will
make a good price of them for itt continews here on the rising hand, if you finde the
Envoyce sight please to give mee creditt for the valeu £183:160 9 slemish, upon the
acctt of the estate of JB. deseated, the rest due to said acctt. is yett in Dandes
of fhn Caile de coninck, & am about itt to gett itt in so that I hope to cleame i
iddainly
a 11 d
Londen mr. Jenry Collier
mij last to yn wat on the 8th curtt. sence non from you, so this to advise you that fehe
vale wartt mee eanseley not to aftront, or trouble him, that he would have send the
valew of £100 sts before now butt noth with standing my desire, that he sould do so
cett never a word of answer fo I doubt vere much that thinghs are wouse with
hur then I exspected, I'll waite this day to a frrind of mine & procose that
in should give ficurite, or suffer the seventie of law, which if doth not tr te will
be a bad omen of which shall advise you rext, Inclosed one froms uttm
Brussel mr. Joseph Sabbearen
a 11 d
I'exspect some ells of seer cloth according to my formar desire now come to
Intreat you in behalfe of my vere good freind m. Hemy Colles of london, that you
would be pleased to do mee the hindness to deliver the inclosed letter in handes
of Jan vale, whres billsn here are dayly protested for non payment, amonghst
others 3 each of a Llv0 of m Collier, who most einstly desires mee to seep
to Boussels & gett eithers securitie or the valew from s and as much he
huth don, in desiring m. Sonthell to come from lille butt be can not come, & I
not gett, butt he beeng so ingens, for feare of loss, desires mee to gett sicunte
oneway or other, yett I can not aprehend any thing of that natine, butt have
neally better thoughts of him noth uithstanding that he hath positively fcomised
to send mee £100- & ths week, & sends not a faithiuy n'ay doth not ostend you
to much as answer my last lebers, there fore pray if itt doth not ostend yo
descomte huim what he intends to do, & in wat manner he can propose sicurite
or satisf. for I have payd £200- for hone of the drawer, & am clarged with flo 3 st
more for the first risurned bill. if he hath mony ready, lett be as much as itt will
pray receave itt from hm, for itt might be he will excuse him self, that he could not finde
occasion to remitt, so pray do at you would be don by if you hall the ike occasion
in Eng, or elsewhere, where I assure you both m. Collier a I will make itt a peare
the oblig. which ly this wee shall have, for what wee can ostaine with good meanes
needt noother e
